fee_structure.demonstrate_domain_expertise_in_the_fiel: Demonstrate consultative decision making with empathy, clarity and comprehensiveness while respecting diversity among various stakeholders in the field of psycho-oncology
Demonstrate ethical and analytical research skills and contribute to knowledge sharing among various stakeholders
Demonstrate professional competencies and practise skills needed in a multidisciplinary team in psycho-oncology settings

Demonstrate skills in evaluating research from a critical perspective, exhibit proficiency in evidence-based clinical practices and participate in community-oriented action research in psycho-oncology settings
Illustrate the relation between physiological and psychological domains of oncology
Demonstrate skills to work with individuals and families of people with oncological conditions at different stages of their lifespan
Deal with ethical and moral dilemmas in end-of-life care with knowledge about the national and international policies and standards of care in palliative and end-of-life care

eligibility:
PO1:
Demonstrate domain expertise in the field of psycho-oncology including theoretical foundations of human behavior
PO2:
Demonstrate consultative decision making with empathy, clarity and comprehensiveness while respecting diversity among various stakeholders in the field of psycho-oncology
PO3:
Demonstrate ethical and analytical research skills and contribute to knowledge sharing among various stakeholders
PO4:
Demonstrate professional competencies and practise skills needed in a multidisciplinary team in psycho-oncology settings
PO5:
Demonstrate skills in evaluating research from a critical perspective, exhibit proficiency in evidence-based clinical practices and participate in community-oriented action research in psycho-oncology settings
PO6:
Illustrate the relation between physiological and psychological domains of oncology
PO7:
Demonstrate skills to work with individuals and families of people with oncological conditions at different stages of their lifespan
PO8:
Deal with ethical and moral dilemmas in end-of-life care with knowledge about the national and international policies and standards of care in palliative and end-of-life care
why_choose: Why choose this course? Hands on experience in evidence based practice Enhancement of professional competency Skills building in working with diverse range of stakeholders Culture sensitive practice to enhance the quality of life of clients Establishing the linkages and liasoning to address the care recipients Proficiency in research and analytical skills
what_learn: What you will learn? Clinical skills to work efficiently with the clients and the family members Analytical and reflective skills to make informed decision in treatment keeping the ethics intact Research skills in terms of planning and conducting research studies Academic writing and publication to contribute to the scientific community Culture inclusive community based care at preventive, promotive and curative level Communication skills to work with the vulnerable population in cancer care settings
modules: Modules Neurobiological basis of cancer Evidence based clinical practice and counseling skills Year 1 Psychosocial aspects of cancer Site specific cancer, genetic counseling and palliative care Research and academic writing Year 2 Ethics and communication skills in cancer care settings
career: Career prospects Consultant Psycho-Oncologists at NGOs related to Cancer Care, Cancer Hospitals MPhil in Clinical Psycho-Oncology Research (Ph.D.) Private researchers at different organisations Community oriented/ app based cancer projects at different countries Practitioners  in the field of Tobacco Cessation Practitioners in palliative care settings and hospices Fellowships in Clinical Psycho-Oncology Policy Makers in field of Psycho-Oncology Trauma counsellors in trauma centers
